column2: This is the Teacher Short Survey [teacher_short_v1.0.0].
column3: Q1. Does your school have a phone policy?
column4: Q2. Under your school’s phone policy, when are students allowed to use their phones at school? Select all that apply.
column5: Q3. How does your school restrict access to phones? Select all that apply.
column6: Q4. Overall, how satisfied are you with your school's phone policy?
column7: Q5. How consistently do teachers and staff enforce your school's cell phone policy? Give your best guess.
column8: Q6. What percentage of your students are using their phone when they shouldn’t be? Give your best guess.
column9: Q7. In your opinion, should your school's phone policy be more or less restrictive than it is now?
column10: Q8. What challenges have you faced with implementing and/or enforcing the phone policy?
column11: Q9. Do you have any suggestions for overcoming those barriers?
column12: Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree that the following statements apply to your students. A significant number of my students… [Q10a. Seem interested in school]
column13: Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree that the following statements apply to your students. A significant number of my students… [Q10b. Maintain positive and respectful relationships with each other]
column14: Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree that the following statements apply to your students. A significant number of my students… [Q10c. Participate in class discussions and other activities]
column15: Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree that the following statements apply to your students. A significant number of my students… [Q10d. Persist when tasks are challenging]
column16: Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree that the following statements apply to your students. A significant number of my students… [Q10e. Are easily distracted]
column17: Q10. Please rate how strongly you agree that the following statements apply to your students. A significant number of my students… [Q10f. Have difficulty staying on task]
column18: Q11. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [Q11a. I am satisfied with my co-workers’ competence.]
column19: Q11. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [Q11b. I am satisfied with the behavior among my students.]
column20: Q11. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [Q11c. I am satisfied with my parent interactions at my school.]
column21: Q11. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [Q11d. I feel supported by my school’s administration with respect to our phone policy.]
column22: Q11. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [Q11e. I enjoy teaching.]
column23: Q11. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [Q11f. I often get frustrated during my time teaching in the classroom.]
column24: Q11. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [Q11g. Teaching often drains my energy.]
column25: Q12. Please share any other major changes at this school within the past school year that might have affected student behavior or school climate (e.g., policy changes, large student turnover, etc.).
column26: Q13. Please share any other thoughts you have about your school's phone policy.
column27: Q14. Is there anything else you want to share with us?
column28: Q15. What grade level(s) do you primarily teach?
column29: Q16. Area(s) taught: (Mark all that apply)
column30: Q17. At what academic level do you teach the majority of your classes?
column31: Q18. How many total years of experience do you have working in education (any role)?
column33: Q20. With which racial/ethnic groups do you identify? You can select more than one.
column34: RQ1. Overall, how would you say this new phone policy has changed your school?
column35: RQ2. Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your students’ behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] … [RQ2a. Students seem more focused in class.]
column36: RQ2. Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your students’ behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] … [RQ2b. Students seem less distracted.]
column37: RQ2. Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your students’ behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] … [RQ2c. Students have developed better social skills.]

column4: Never (only before the first bell and after the last bell)
